subject: Cooking
title: Potatoes: How a Root Saved Europe
description: A micro-lesson that makes Potatoes: How a Root Saved Europe usable.

hook.text: Europeans refused to eat potatoes for over a century. Then they prevented a continent from starving.

buildup.text: Spanish conquistadors brought potatoes from Peru in the 1530s, but Europeans viewed them with suspicion.

discovery.text: Potatoes yield 2-4 times more calories per acre than grain â€” a lifesaver for growing populations.

twist.text: Frederick the Great of Prussia forced peasants to plant potatoes. He posted guards around royal potato fields.

climax.text: By 1800, the potato fed most of Northern Europe. Its failure in Ireland caused a devastating famine.

punchline.text: A Peruvian root became Europe's most important food.

quiz.question: Where did potatoes originate before arriving in Europe?
